description: This course explores the childbearing process in healthy and high-risk families.
Clinical experiences are provided with families during pregnancy, labor and delivery, and
following birth. Clinical settings include hospital birth centers, clinics, simulation,
and home care agencies. Students develop the role of educator by working with parents to
integrate and care for a new member of the family system.  Offered annually in the fall
semester. Counts toward women's and gender studies major and concentration. Prerequisite:
